multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have intermittent red bumps and sometimes pus-filled bumps on my face, neck, chest, and back that appear about a week before my menstrual period and clear up a week after my period ends.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I've been experiencing these symptoms since my adolescent years.
Do you have a family history of any skin related issues like acne or similar symptoms?
I don't have information on my family history regarding skin-related issues.
Have you used any medication or topical treatments for your symptoms? If so, what type and for how long?
Yes, I used isotretinoin 6 years ago, which was effective at that time.
Have you noticed any association between your diet or stress levels and the worsening of your symptoms?
No, I haven't noticed any specific association between my diet or stress levels and the worsening of my symptoms.
Final Diagnosis: Hormonal acne
